page.title: 07SCHOOL DINNERS
page.content: A school meal costs 60 pence for one day. If the parents of a child are unemployed then the meal is provided free. In our school 145 out of 178 children stay for dinner. When it is time for dinner, first we wash our hands and say our prayers and wait for the dinner supervisors to give out the cutlery which is made from stainless steel. We then walk to the kitchen hatch and collect our food on a plate made from pottery. The menu for the week beginning 1st July 1985 was:{Monday}Potato, stew carrots, jelly and biscuit.{Tuesday Yorkshire pudding, sausage, cabbage, jam tart and custard.{Wednesday}mutton and potato pastie, carrots, yogurt. {Thursday}Fish cakes, tomatoes, beans, potatoes, ginger sponge and white sauce.{Friday}Roast pork, carrots, cauliflower, apple crumble, custard.
